property.name: Addresses
property.tp:docstring:
Array of arrays of IPv4 address/prefix/gateway. All 3 elements of each array are in network byte order. Essentially: [(addr, prefix, gateway), (addr, prefix, gateway), ...]
Deprecated: use AddressData and Gateway

property.name: AddressData
property.tp:docstring: Array of IP address data objects. All addresses will include "address" (an IP address string), and "prefix" (a uint). Some addresses may include additional attributes.

property.name: Routes
property.tp:docstring:
Arrays of IPv4 route/prefix/next-hop/metric. All 4 elements of each tuple are in network byte order. 'route' and 'next hop' are IPv4 addresses, while prefix and metric are simple unsigned integers. Essentially: [(route, prefix, next-hop, metric), (route, prefix, next-hop, metric), ...]
Deprecated: use RouteData

property.name: RouteData
property.tp:docstring: Array of IP route data objects. All routes will include "dest" (an IP address string) and "prefix" (a uint). Some routes may include "next-hop" (an IP address string), "metric" (a uint), and additional attributes.

property.name: Domains
property.tp:docstring: A list of domains this address belongs to.

property.name: DnsOptions
property.tp:docstring: A list of DNS options that modify the behavior of the DNS resolver. See resolv.conf(5) manual page for the list of supported options.

property.name: WinsServers
property.tp:docstring: The Windows Internet Name Service servers associated with the connection. Each address is in network byte order.

arg.name: properties
arg.tp:docstring: A dictionary mapping property names to variant boxed values
